Class QRAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.monnetproject.math.sparse.eigen.QRAlgorithm

extends Object
    Based on "Matrix Computations" (1990) by Golub & van Loan. 2nd Edition page 423
    Author:
    John McCrae

    • Method Detail

      • givens

        public static double[] givens(double a,
              double b)
        Finds [c,s] satisfying T [ c s ] [ a ] = [ r ] [ -s c ] [ b ] = [ 0 ] subject to c^2 + s^2 = 1
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        Returns:
        [c,s]

      • wilkinsonShift

        public static void wilkinsonShift(double[] alpha,
                  double[] beta,
                  int o,
                  int n,
                  SequenceOfGivens givensSeq)
        Apply the implicit QR Wilkinson shift. This in place calculates a new tridiagonal such that the last beta[o+(n-1)] =~ 0.0. This method assumes that beta[o-1] =~ 0.0 and beta[o+n] =~ 0.0 but does not check this result.
        Parameters:
        alpha - The diagonal of the tridiagonal matrix
        beta - The off-diagonal of the tridiagonal matrix
        o - The offset
        n - The size of the sub-matrix to consider

      • qrSolve

        public static QRAlgorithm.Solution qrSolve(SparseMatrix<Double> A,
                           double epsilon)
        Find the eigenvalues of sparse matrix by means of a Lanczos-QR method.
        Parameters:
        A - The matrix
        epsilon - The error rate
        Returns:
        The eigenvalues of the matrix
